intro: Prenanthes stewartii, commonly known as the Stewart's bladderwort, is a small flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas of North America. It belongs to the genus Prenanthes in the family Araceae, characterized by its unique inflorescence composed of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in a compact, globular structure. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams. Prenanthes stewartii is an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and aquatic life.
